body.name: Spy: A Novel
body.description: #1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER • A young woman is caught up in a dangerous double life on behalf of her country during World War II in Danielle Steel’s thrilling new novel. At eighteen, Alexandra Wickham is presented to King George V and Queen Mary in an exquisite white lace and satin dress her mother has ordered from Paris. With her delicate blond looks, she is a stunning beauty who seems destined for a privileged life. But fate, a world war, and her own quietly rebellious personality lead her down a different path. By 1939, Europe is on fire and England is at war. From her home in idyllic Hampshire, Alex makes her way to London as a volunteer in the First Aid Nursing Yeomanry. But she has skills that draw the attention of another branch of the service. Fluent in French and German, she would make the perfect secret agent. Within a year, Alex is shocking her family in trousers and bright red lipstick. They must never know about the work she does—no one can know, not even the pilot she falls in love with. While her country and those dearest to her pay the terrible price of war, Alex learns the art of espionage, leading to life-and-death missions behind enemy lines and a long career as a spy in exotic places and historic times. Spy follows Alex’s extraordinary adventures in World War II and afterward in India, Pakistan, Morocco, Hong Kong, Moscow, and Washington, D.C., when her husband, Richard, enters the foreign service and both become witnesses to a rapidly changing world from post-war to Cold War. She lives life on the edge, with a secret she must always keep hidden. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This novel is spell bounding and intriguing. It goes from cradled to grave so to speak through several generations. Definitely would recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved Everything About Spy, With The Exception of Last Page
reviews.reviewText: I fell in love with Spy even before I read the first page, what drew me in was the cover and from there it was rollercoster ride of mystery, intrigue, all wrapped in a 1940's plot of WW2, England and a young women's desire to do something other than to marry into a wealthy family. Danielle Steele did not disappoint this time, with lots of details of the beginning impact of WW2 when children were sent to the country to be safe from bombings in England, to how a spy is born. The various countries we have the opporuntunity to visit throughout the novel provides the difference in living as someone affluent in the military and those who are not as fortunate. The only downside I had with the novel was the the very end, it seemed to wrap up quite abruptly to me. I would have liked to see where Alexandra's remaining life lead her with the new man/friend in her life. As I said, though, a minor thing in my opinion. One of Danielle Stelle's best work in a long time, very reminiscent of her early works.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It was ok Nita’s good as most of her books. Didn’t keep my attention. Took me a while to read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed the strong female character, she was well developed and drew you quickly into the story. The story slows considerably about halfway through, picking up again with more surprises. I couldn’t put this book down. Thoroughly enjoyed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I was quickly hooked!
reviews.reviewText: An enlightening look into the life of a spy! With Danielle Steel's latest release SPY, she delves into the life of a family in late 1930's Hampshire as World War II is raging and their loved ones are getting into the midst of it all.Finding herself at odds with what life is expecting of her and where it's leading her, Alexandra sets out to volunteer during the war at the First Aid Nursing center, but her fluent language skills quickly gain the attention of intelligence that tempts her into spying on the enemy. During this time she meets and falls in love with a pilot, but she must keep her secret assignments to herself.We continue to follow her life and assignments as the war ends and she marries her pilot and goes on to raise a family as she continues to compile secrets she can share with no one.I highly recommend this story to anyone who enjoys a historical romance intermixed with turmoil, secrets and intrigue. Alexandra was easy to become enchanted with, and following her through all of her exploits was quite riveting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Never a disappointment....
reviews.reviewText: I got this book this past summer for my mom for her birthday and since we couldn't have a party due to the Covid 19 restrictions I had it shipped straight to her home. I first had a sample sent to my kindle to see if it was something that she would enjoy. I haven't read any Danielle Steel books for quite a while although I've never been disappointed in any of them in the past and I we are both fans of books set during WWII. So then once hooked I had to buy it for my own. I really enjoyed this book I was quickly reminded that she never had any problems with having main characters go through deaths of close friends and family members and won't say anything more as to not give any spoilers away. If you have not read any Danielle Steel lately or have followed her book after book I highly recommend this book to both types of her readers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Little heavy on the history for me
reviews.reviewText: This book was ok, a little heavy and overly detailed on some of the history, and some things were repeated and over explained in some chapters. I usually like Danielle Steel’s books, but sometimes I feel like her stories repeat. Since she writes 7 books per year, it feels like she may be running out of original ideas or forgetting that she has used some of these plots already. Not my favorite but not the worst one she’s written.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, what an interesting read.
reviews.reviewText: Filled with intrigue and suspense. This Author really makes the scenarios rich and filled with mystery. She’s my favorite Author.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good read and have passed it along to a friend on my recommendation.
reviews.reviewText: An interesting plot with lots to learn about the second World War with personal perspectives.A happy ending much needed in these times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a wonderful story, full of intrigue and humour at times. Slowly working my way through all of her books.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hab mich durchs erste 1/4 gekämpft. Mehr ging wirklich nicht.
reviews.reviewText: Das Buch ist äußerst langweilig, ergeht sich in unendlichen Wiederholungen und ist in sehr, sehr flacher Sprache geschrieben.

She is an intelligent English woman who becomes a spy because of her ideas about politics and her ability to speak several languages. The book tells the story since she was a teenager until she was 84 years old or more. So it is a big story that is worth reading. In the story, there are loss, romance, secrets, emotions, and big adventures.
The story is well constructe. Reading this book is like travelling through so many different places but also historically & politically visiting cultures & people!
